intro: Apteron, commonly known as the common apteron, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences, which are typical of the carrot family. The plants typically grow in temperate regions and are often found in moist, well-drained soils. They are known for their aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. Apteron species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
